author: BHARTI JAIN
description: A nationwide civil defence drill, initiated by the home ministry, saw widespread participation exceeding initial expectations, encompassing nearly 350 districts and 1.5 million individuals. The exercise aimed to test and reinforce safety protocols like blackouts and evacuations, revealing both successful enforcement and identified gaps in the existing civil defence infrastructure, particularly regarding outdated equipment and coordination in key areas like Delhi airport.
title: 15 lakh people across nation join hands to test & enforce safety measures

author: TNN
description: Following heightened tensions, twenty-seven airports across north, west, and central India were temporarily closed, leading to the cancellation of 430 Indian flights on Thursday. Pakistan also experienced significant flight disruptions, with 147 cancellations. Airspace over Pakistan and western India saw a complete absence of civilian air traffic as airlines rerouted flights, primarily impacting international routes.
title: 27 airports shut; over 400 flights cancelled today

author: TNN
description: Following the Pahalgam massacre, India launched 'Operation Sindoor' as a retaliatory strike, with BJP leaders hailing the action. Home Minister Amit Shah affirmed the government's commitment to eradicating terrorism, while Defence Minister Rajnath Singh likened the operation to Lord Hanuman's actions. BJP President J P Nadda emphasized India's resolve, and Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan declared the Pahalgam attack avenged, showcasing India's strength under PM Modi's leadership.
title: Amit Shah hails armed forces, Rajnath Singh invokes Hanuman

author: TNN
description: The daily Beating Retreat ceremony at the Attari-Wagah border has been suspended, according to reports. Citing security concerns following the recent terrorist attack in Kashmir and Operation Sindoor, BSF officials announced the halt to the elaborate display. A BSF officer stated that the decision was made due to decreased visitor numbers and heightened security risks.
title: Beating Retreat at Attari stalled indefinitely

author: TNN
description: Following escalating Indo-Pak tensions, border states Punjab, Rajasthan, and Gujarat are experiencing significant disruptions. Mass displacement is occurring in Punjab's Ferozepur district, leading to school closures and panic buying in cities like Amritsar. Rajasthan's border districts are on high alert with increased patrolling and activated air defense systems, while Gujarat sees intensified marine and paramilitary patrols along its coastal areas.
title: Families start evacuating women, kids & elderly from villages bordering Pak

author: TNN
description: The government has scheduled an all-party meeting on Thursday to brief key political leaders on Operation Sindoor. Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju announced the meeting, which Defence Minister Rajnath Singh is expected to chair. Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge will attend, with the party hoping Prime Minister Modi will preside over the briefing following the operation.
title: Government to brief key leaders at all-party meeting today

author: SACHIN PARASHAR
description: India conducted military strikes, Operation Sindoor, targeting terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan, citing the Pahalgam attack as a catalyst. Foreign Secretary Misri emphasized the strikes were non-escalatory and proportionate, linking the TRF to Lashkar-e-Taiba and Pakistan. India aims to deter further cross-border attacks and dismantle terror networks, highlighting Pakistan's failure to act against its own terrorist infrastructure and its history of misleading the international community on terrorism.
title: Message to world: Strikes were in line with UNSC call to punish terrorists

author: TNN
description: PM Modi, known for live addresses, recorded a message for a space exploration conference, coinciding with India's strikes in Pakistan and POK following the Pahalgam killings. The recorded speech, delivered calmly, focused on India's space achievements and its commitment to global collaboration in space exploration, even as the government prepared for potential retaliation.
title: PM Modi's recorded speech hints he locked May 7 for strike

author: SACHIN PARASHAR
description: Following Operation Sindoor, NSA Ajit Doval briefed global counterparts, including those from the US, UK, and China, emphasizing India's non-escalatory response and readiness to retaliate if provoked. India highlighted the precision of its strikes, avoiding civilian targets, while urging de-escalation. International reactions varied, with many condemning terrorism and calling for restraint, though some expressed concerns over escalation and urged dialogue between India and Pakistan.
title: Post strike, India mounts fresh diplomatic offensive

author: TNN
description: Following the launch of Operation Sindoor, several foreign nations issued travel advisories for India. Canada cautioned its citizens about potential flight disruptions and escalating tensions, advising them to stay informed and follow local authority instructions. The United States also warned its citizens against travel to Jammu & Kashmir, citing potential flight disruptions across India.
title: US, Canada issue travel advisories for India

author: TNN
description: Maulana Masood Azhar confirmed the death of ten family members in an Indian attack on Markaz Subhan Allah, a JeM seminary in Bahawalpur. Azhar expressed a desire to have joined them, while JeM identified his sister, her husband, and other relatives among the deceased. The UN-sanctioned terrorist, linked to numerous attacks in India, operates with ISI backing from the facility.
title: 10 of Parliament, Pulwama strike mastermind's family killed

author: CHETHAN KUMAR
description: The Axiom-4 mission, with India's Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla as pilot, faces a possible delay due to a minor technical issue, though the launch is still targeted for May 29. Isro chairman V Narayanan expressed confidence in the SpaceX launch vehicle and spacecraft for the mission to the ISS. Shukla will conduct seven experiments, fostering microgravity research in India during the 14-day stay.
title: Ax-4 mission, with Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, may get delayed

author: CHETHAN KUMAR
description: Operation Sindoor utilized SkyStriker suicide drones, manufactured in Bengaluru through a joint venture between Alpha Design and Israel's Elbit Security Systems. These loitering munitions, procured by the Indian Army in 2021, feature a 100km range and carry a 5-10kg warhead. Their silent operation and precision strike capabilities offer a significant advantage in modern warfare, enhancing situational awareness for troops.
title: Bengaluru-made ‘suicide drones’ make debut with Operation Sindoor

author: TNN
description: An unidentified aircraft crashed near Aklian Kalan village in Bathinda, Punjab, resulting in the death of a civilian and injuries to ten others who approached the wreckage site. The incident occurred around 1:30 am, prompting a response from authorities who collected debris from the area, located approximately 20km from Bhisiana airbase. The IAF has not yet commented on the incident.
title: IAF declines to comment on crash reports

author: RAJAT PANDIT
description: In anticipation of potential retaliation from Pakistan, India has fortified its defense systems across land, air, and sea. The air defense network is activated, warships are deployed, and frontline units are prepared. Strategic Forces Command is on high alert, with new weapon systems integrated since Balakot, enhancing India's readiness to respond to any misadventure.
title: India on high alert on land, air & sea

author: TNN
title: Operation name itself was show of solidarity

author: ARVIND CHAUHAN
description: Wing Commander Vyomika Singh, a Lucknow native and seasoned helicopter pilot, represented India's "Nari Shakti" at a press briefing detailing Operation Sindoor, the nation's airstrike response to the Pahalgam terror attack. Commissioned in 2004, she quickly rose through the ranks, specializing in Chetak and Cheetah helicopters with over 2,500 flying hours.
title: Operation Sindoor: A girl who grew up to 'own the skies'

author: PRASHANT RUPERA
description: Vadodara celebrated Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, a third-generation military officer, as she addressed the nation on Operation Sindoor, India's response to the Pahalgam terrorist attack. Hailing from a family with a strong tradition of service, Col Qureshi's dedication to the nation is deeply rooted. Her accomplishments include commanding an Army contingent in a multinational military exercise and serving with UN peacekeeping forces.
title: Operation Sindoor: Biochemist who left PhD for the uniform

author: TNN
description: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, Prime Minister Modi authorized Operation Sindoor, defying international calls for restraint and skepticism about India's response. The precision strikes, showcasing advanced weaponry, countered Pakistan's nuclear threats and reaffirmed Modi's strong stance on national security. This decisive action silenced critics and bolstered public confidence, signaling a higher risk appetite for future security challenges and reinforcing the BJP's dominance in security matters.
title: Strikes steel PM Modi's iron man credentials

author: NASEER GANAI
description: Tensions flared in Uri after a terrorist attack in Pahalgam, stirring memories of past escalations and the 2016 surgical strikes. Despite a period of relative peace since 2003, residents prepared for the worst, cleaning bunkers and fearing renewed violence. Overnight precision strikes triggered massive Pakistani shelling, forcing evacuations and disrupting daily life, leaving the community in uncertainty as they sought shelter.
title: Wednesday morning turns back clock in Uri to 1998 as heavy shelling begins

author: TNN
description: Karukachal police arrested Anshad Kabir and Ujaz Abdul Salam, both natives of Kanjirappally, in connection with the death of Neethu Krishnan. The investigation revealed that Krishnan's death, initially reported as a traffic accident near Karukachal, was actually a murder. Police determined that the suspects were acquainted with the victim and aware of the crime; the investigation is ongoing to determine the motive.
title: Woman’s death: Road accident turns out to be murder, two held

author: SHIVANI AZAD
description: A flu-like outbreak has led to the quarantine of over 1,000 mules and horses, suspending equine services on the Kedarnath yatra route for a third day. Following the deaths of 15 animals and detection of equine influenza symptoms, authorities have isolated affected animals and initiated widespread screening and treatment.
title: 1,000 equines on Kedarnath route in quarantine after ‘virus outbreak’

author: KAUTILYA SINGH
description: The Char Dham yatra has experienced a 26% decrease in pilgrim footfall compared to last year, with 2.9 lakh devotees visiting the shrines. Officials attribute this decline to improved planning and staggered registration, implemented to prevent overcrowding. Despite the slower start due to the staggered opening schedule, the yatra is expected to gain momentum later in May, with over 25 lakh people already registered.
title: 26% dip in first week’s Char Dham footfall compared to 2024

author: TNN
description: Following Indian government intervention, Sotheby's Hong Kong has postponed the auction of the Piprahwa Buddhist Relics. The culture ministry, along with the Archaeological Survey of India and the Ministry of External Affairs, will engage stakeholders to discuss the relics' repatriation to India. A delegation emphasized the relics' sacred significance and rightful ownership by India, leading to the auction's postponement.
title: After India's intervention, Sotheby's puts off relics auction

author: RASHMI DROLIA
description: Ishika Bala, a class 10 student from the Maoist-affected Kanker district, triumphed over blood cancer and emerged as the state board exam topper with an impressive 99.2%. Her success story shines as a beacon of hope in a region with low female literacy. Akhil Sen, the class 12 commerce topper, also hails from Kanker, highlighting the district's academic excellence.
title: Cancer survivor tops Chhattisgarh Class X boards with 99.2 per cent

author: TNN
description: The Supreme Court has enhanced EVM integrity checks by ruling that the symbol loading unit must remain unchanged during candidate-requested mock polls. This order came with the acceptance of the Election Commission's amended technical SOP, which includes self-diagnosis and mutual authentication. Engineers will also certify the software and memory of EVMs to ensure they haven't been tampered with.
title: Can't change EVM symbol loading unit for mock vote: Supreme Court

author: ALEX FERNANDES
description: Pillu, a seven-year-old cat in Pune, underwent a groundbreaking surgery to receive a pacemaker due to a dangerously low heart rate of 50 bpm. The procedure, performed by veterinary and human medical experts, addressed a complete heart block caused by myocarditis. Pillu is now recovering well, marking a significant advancement in Indian veterinary cardiology.
title: Cat having poor heart rate gets pacemaker, a 'first for country'

author: TNN
title: Drone found near Assam-Bangladesh border area

author: TNN
description: A devastating head-on collision between an SUV and a sand-laden truck on Patiala-Samana road claimed six lives, including five schoolchildren aged between seven and twelve. The accident occurred near Nassupur village, leaving seven others injured. The impact was so severe that the SUV was mangled, requiring a JCB to retrieve the bodies.
title: Five school children among 6 killed in Patiala accident

author: TNN
description: The "Pushpa Gang," an organized group of pickpockets from Andhra Pradesh, was apprehended at Badrinath shrine for targeting Char Dham pilgrims. The gang, led by Krishna Chhedoja, flew to Uttarakhand and other pilgrimage sites, exploiting crowds to steal valuables. Police recovered cash, mobile phones, and ATM cards after intensified surveillance following numerous theft complaints from devotees.
title: High-flying gang of Char Dham thieves busted at Badrinath shrine

author: SURENDRA SINGH
description: Prime Minister Modi, addressing the GLEX 2025, emphasized India's collaborative approach to space exploration, envisioning a future where its astronauts leave lunar footprints by 2040. He highlighted the upcoming Gaganyaan mission and an Indian astronaut's imminent journey to the International Space Station.
title: India’s space vision aims for global good, says PM Modi

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Following Chennai Super Kings' victory over Kolkata Knight Riders, captain MS Dhoni addressed his IPL future, stating he'll decide after assessing his body's ability to handle the game's demands over the next 6-8 months. Acknowledging fan support, Dhoni, 42, recognises he's in the final phase of his career.
title: MS Dhoni discloses future plans after CSK end losing streak vs KKR

author: SANJAY KHAJURIA AND NASEER GANAI
description: Following India's Operation Sindoor, Pakistan initiated heavy artillery and mortar fire along the LoC in J&K, resulting in a tragic loss of civilian lives, including children, and numerous injuries. The intense shelling, impacting areas like Poonch and Rajouri, prompted evacuations and shelter activations. Authorities are providing relief and medical assistance while addressing the escalating cross-border tensions.
title: Pakistan shelling kills 12, prompts evacuation in J&K border districts

author: REMA NAGARAJAN
title: Physiotherapy curriculum uses ‘outdated’ and ‘derogatory’ terms for disabled, say doctors

author: AMIT ANAND CHOUDHARY
description: The Supreme Court has ruled that individuals accused under the anti-money laundering law are entitled to receive a comprehensive list of all documents and materials collected by the Enforcement Directorate during the investigation, including those not directly relied upon in the complaint. This decision aims to ensure a fair trial by allowing the accused access to potentially exculpatory evidence, reinforcing their right to defend themselves effectively.
title: PMLA accused entitled to list of all material collected by ED: SC

author: TNN
description: The Union cabinet has approved a significant expansion of academic and infrastructure capacity for five IITs in Tirupati, Bhilai, Jammu, Dharwad, and Palakkad. This expansion, costing Rs 11,828.7 crore, aims to facilitate education for over 6,500 additional students and nearly double the current capacity to 13,687. The initiative includes creating 130 new faculty positions and establishing five state-of-the-art research parks to enhance industry-academia collaboration.
title: Rs 11,828cr expansion of 5 IITs to add 6.5k seats gets nod

author: NAOMI CANTON
description: The UK government urges Pakistan to intensify efforts against terrorism within its borders, emphasizing the threat it poses to regional stability and its own citizens. British ministers call for de-escalation and dialogue between India and Pakistan amidst rising tensions, offering support for mediation. Concerns are raised about the impact on British nationals and diaspora communities, with some MPs advocating for UNSC involvement.
title: UK government says Pakistan needs to do more to tackle terror threat

author: NAOMI CANTON
description: Despite fears of escalating tensions in Britain following India's military strike, calm prevails as the Indian and Pakistani diaspora maintain amicable relations. Community leaders emphasize that their conflict lies with terrorism, not with any specific community or nationality. While expressing concern for families in the region, British Pakistanis foresee no spillover of tensions onto UK streets, highlighting their shared history and camaraderie.
title: UK PIOs back military strike but there are no tensions with British Pakistani neighbours

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India conducted a nationwide civil defence exercise named 'Operation Abhyaas'. The exercise simulated various emergency scenarios across multiple states and union territories. Drills included air raids, fire emergencies, and rescue missions. Delhi experienced sirens, evacuations, and a brief blackout. Other states like Punjab, Maharashtra, and Tamil Nadu also conducted similar exercises.
title: Blackouts, drills at airports: How India-wide civil defence exercise unfolded

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The Federal Reserve, under Jerome Powell, held steady the benchmark interest rate, amidst concerns about balancing maximum employment and controlling inflation near the 2% target. The Fed will closely monitor incoming data and evolving outlook while reducing its holdings of Treasury securities.
title: Fed holds rates steady at 4.25–4.5% in Powell-led meet

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Chennai Super Kings defeated Kolkata Knight Riders in a thrilling match. This victory significantly impacts the playoff race. Kolkata Knight Riders' chances for the top four are now uncertain. Chennai Super Kings, though out of contention, displayed a strong performance. The points table sees Gujarat Titans leading, with other teams closely competing for playoff spots.
title: IPL 2025 Points Table: Latest standings after KKR vs CSK match

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Chennai Super Kings defeated Kolkata Knight Riders by two wickets in a thrilling match, jeopardizing KKR's playoff chances and ending CSK's four-match losing streak. Dewald Brevis's explosive innings of 52 off 25 balls shifted the momentum after an early CSK collapse.
title: Noor Ahmad and Dewald Brevis star in CSK's two-wicket win vs KKR

author: OMAR FAROOQ KHAN
description: Following Operation Sindoor, Pakistan's PM Sharif asserted in Parliament that its army swiftly retaliated against Indian strikes, claiming to have downed five Indian jets, though without providing evidence. Pakistan reports casualties in PoK and Punjab, alleging attacks on civilian areas, including a mosque. The NSC condemned India's actions as 'acts of war,' vowing a response and reserving the right to self-defense, while briefing China on the situation.
title: Pak PM claims shooting 5 Indian jets, but provides no proof

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Trump asks India, Pakistan to stop now as 'tit-for-tat' is done

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following a deadly terror attack in Pahalgam, India launched 'Operation Sindoor,' a retaliatory strike destroying nine terrorist infrastructure sites in Pakistan and PoK. Congress leaders Shashi Tharoor lauded the operation and praised its codename's emotional resonance and the armed forces' decisive action. "Clever, especially given the government’s penchant for creative acronyms! But jokes apart, #OperationSindoor is a brilliant name," Tharoor said in a post on X.
title: 'Brilliant name': Tharoor applauds symbolism behind 'Operation Sindoor'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Ravindra Jadeja etched his name in Chennai Super Kings' history, surpassing Dwayne Bravo as the leading IPL wicket-taker with 141 wickets. Kolkata Knight Riders, after winning the toss, posted 179-6, powered by Ajinkya Rahane's impactful innings of 48 and Andre Russell's cameo of 38.
title: Ravindra Jadeja surpasses KKR's mentor, becomes CSK's leading wicket-taker

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Roger Binny and Devajit Saikia lauded Rohit Sharma on his Test retirement, acknowledging his calm leadership and team-first approach. Sharma, who debuted in 2013, played 67 Tests, amassing 4,301 runs with 12 centuries. As captain, he secured 12 wins in 24 Tests, leaving behind a legacy of discipline and excellence, while continuing to participate in ODI campaigns.
title: 'Rohit Sharma's selflessness will inspire future generations'

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Starlink has received a Letter of Intent from the Indian government for its satellite communication services, signaling progress in its pursuit of an Indian satcom license.
title: Starlink gets crucial nod for satcom services in India

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Following Rohit Sharma's Test retirement announcement, head coach Gautam Gambhir dispelled rift rumors with a supportive message, praising Sharma's leadership and contributions. Gambhir had previously dismissed speculation about tension, emphasizing their successful partnership in winning the Champions Trophy. Former teammate Shikhar Dhawan also celebrated Sharma's Test career, wishing him well for the future.
title: 'A gem': Gautam Gambhir writes a heartfelt post for Rohit Sharma

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rohit Sharma has announced his retirement from Test cricket, concluding a career where he scored 4301 runs in 67 Tests, including 12 centuries. The 38-year-old will continue to lead India in ODIs, having already retired from T20Is. His departure means India needs a new Test captain for the upcoming series in England.
title: 'Always my first skipper': Who said what on Rohit Sharma's retirement?

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Amazon has unveiled Vulcan, a new robot with a sense of touch. This allows it to handle tasks previously done by humans. Vulcan can move items and detect force to prevent damage. Amazon says Vulcan will work with employees to improve safety and efficiency. The company states robots have created new job categories within Amazon.
title: Amazon takes on Elon Musk’s Tesla with robot that has ‘sense of touch’

author: PRAMOD GAIKWAD
description: In a cinematic landscape driven by high-budget spectacles, action-packed sequences, and star-studded lineups, Chhaava, a film rooted in the life of Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, has carved a unique space by resonating deeply with audiences, especially in Maharashtra. Its success lies not in glitz, but in its grounded narrative and cultural authenticity. ETimes spoke to audiences to understand what drew them to Chhaava.
title: Chhaava's success proves audiences want stories, not stars

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Delhi Capitals have signed Afghanistan's Sediqullah Atal for Rs 1.25 Crore as a replacement for Harry Brook, who opted out of IPL 2025 due to personal reasons. Atal, known for his aggressive batting, averages 34.25 in T20s and played a key role in Afghanistan's ACC Men’s T20 Emerging Teams Asia Cup 2024 victory.
title: IPL 2025: Who is Delhi Capitals new recruit Sediqullah Atal?

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: US lawmakers are expressing concerns over Elon Musk's dual roles as SpaceX CEO and a government employee overseeing changes at NASA and the Department of Defense. They highlight a potential conflict of interest, suggesting Musk's influence could unfairly benefit SpaceX in securing government contracts. The lawmakers are urging greater scrutiny to maintain public trust in government contracting processes.
title: US lawmakers writes to defense secretary: Musk's dual role creates …

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: In a striking coincidence, Rohit Sharma mirrored MS Dhoni's retirement timing, announcing his exit at 19:29 IST, reminiscent of Dhoni's 2020 departure. Sharma, 38, declared his Test retirement via Instagram, expressing gratitude for the support he received. His career concluded with 4301 runs in 67 matches, including 12 centuries, and a commendable captaincy record.
title: 17:29: Rohit Sharma follows the footsteps of MS Dhoni

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Dell is undergoing a significant organizational restructuring, mandating larger teams for managers and reducing management layers to accelerate decision-making in the age of AI. This overhaul involves dismissals, demotions, and a shift towards individual contributor roles for some managers. These changes are part of a broader strategic evolution, including workforce reductions and a return to full-time office work.
title: Dell has a new requirement for VPs and above: Have at least…

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Flyer deplaned from Air India flight amid high alert post 'Op Sindoor'

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Gold prices in India surged past Rs 1 lakh per 10 grams, fueled by escalating India-Pakistan tensions following reported missile strikes on terrorist targets. The surge prompted investors to seek safe-haven assets. Silver prices also rose, while international spot gold declined due to easing global geopolitical concerns amid US-China trade talks.
title: Gold prices cross Rs 1 lakh per 10 grams amid India-Pak tensions

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Following the Pahalgam terror attack and escalating tensions, Indian stock markets have shown resilience, with Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex rising. Conversely, Pakistan's stock market crashed, reflecting economic vulnerabilities and investor jitters.
title: India soars, Pak crashes! Contrasting stock market tales

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rohit Sharma's retirement from Test cricket prompted a heartfelt reaction from his wife, Ritika Sajdeh, who expressed her emotions with heartbreak emojis on social media. Sharma, aged 38, concluded his Test career with 4,301 runs in 67 matches, including 12 centuries. He captained India in 24 Tests, securing 12 wins. He will continue to represent India in the ODI format.
title: Ritika Sajdeh reacts to Rohit Sharma’s Test retirement

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rohit Sharma, the seasoned Indian cricketer, has announced his retirement from Test cricket after a decade-long career. The 38-year-old shared his decision on Instagram, expressing gratitude for representing India in the longest format. This move comes amid speculation about his place in the Test side, especially with the England series approaching.
title: Rohit Sharma retires: Here's a glance at his Test stats and milestones

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rohit Sharma, India's Test captain, has retired at 37. His last match was against Australia in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. India lost the series 1-3. Sharma became captain in 2021 after Virat Kohli. He led India to the World Test Championship final. India won against West Indies and England under his leadership. However, India lost to New Zealand and Australia.
title: Rohit Sharma retires: Here's a look at his captaincy record in Test cricket

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Ahead of the IPL match between KKR and CSK, Eden Gardens paid tribute to the Indian Armed Forces for Operation Sindoor, a strategic missile operation. This operation targeted sites in Pakistan and Pakistan Occupied Kashmir following the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 tourists.
title: Watch: National anthem played at Eden Gardens ahead of KKR vs CSK match

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Pakistani Army's shelling in Jammu and Kashmir's border areas, including the Line of Control, resulted in at least 12 fatalities, including four children, and 57 injuries. Poonch district was the worst hit. This occurred after Indian forces struck terrorist sites in Pakistan and PoK under "Operation Sindoor." Indian Army retaliated, causing significant damage to Pakistani posts.
title: 12 dead in Pakistan shelling across LoC, J&K's Poonch worst hit

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: MS Dhoni reminisced about his extensive cricket experience at Eden Gardens, hinting it could be his last appearance at the venue. With CSK out of playoff contention, Dhoni emphasized the importance of evaluating players for the next season, giving opportunities to Urvil Patel and others.
title: Final goodbye? MS Dhoni reminisces his early playing days at Eden Gardens

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Indian Embassy warns Chinese state media over ‘disinformation’ on strikes targeting Pak

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Kolkata Knight Riders made a significant change by dropping Venkatesh Iyer due to his poor performance, despite his high price tag. With playoff hopes on the line, KKR captain Ajinkya Rahane chose to bat first against Chennai Super Kings. This crucial match at Eden Gardens is a must-win for KKR to stay in contention for a playoff spot.
title: IPL 2025: KKR drops Rs 23.75 cr player from playing XI vs CSK

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Jos Buttler, the Gujarat Titans' star, delighted Mumbai fans by playing street cricket with local kids, sharing the heartwarming moments on social media. Buttler's impressive IPL 2025 performance includes 500 runs in 11 matches, averaging 71.43, as the Gujarat Titans secured a top spot after defeating Mumbai Indians, enhancing their playoff chances.
title: 'Nasty fasty': Jos Buttler plays gully cricket in the streets of Mumbai

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Operation sindoor: Delhi airport sees cancellation of 140 flights

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following Operation Sindoor, NSA Ajit Doval assured counterparts in the US, UK, Saudi Arabia, and other nations that India doesn't intend to escalate tensions with Pakistan. Doval emphasized that India's actions were measured and restrained, but the nation is fully prepared to retaliate decisively if Pakistan initiates any hostile actions. He briefed officials on the precision strikes targeting terror infrastructure.
title: 'Prepared to ...': What NSA Doval told China about Op Sindoor

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: PwC has recently laid off approximately 1,500 employees in the U.S., primarily affecting staff in audit and tax departments, due to lower staff turnover and a business review. This decision follows similar job cuts announced by other Big Four firms like Deloitte and KPMG, who are also addressing moderating growth and low attrition rates.
title: PwC cuts 1500 US jobs, alerts staff with Microsoft Teams invite email marked…

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Indian Army released a powerful video showcasing its capabilities just before launching Operation Sindoor, targeting nine terror locations in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir. This swift action followed the video release and was a direct response to the deadly terror attack in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir, where 26 innocent lives were tragically lost on April 22.
title: ‘Ready to strike’: Army posted video moments before launching Op Sindoor

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: In a surprising turn, Rohit Sharma declared his retirement from Test cricket via an Instagram story. This decision comes amidst reports suggesting his place in the upcoming Test series against England was uncertain. While stepping away from the longer format, the 38-year-old will continue to represent India in ODIs.
title: Rohit Sharma announces retirement from Test cricket

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Airtel's plan for 10-minute SIM delivery via Blinkit was halted by the DoT due to national security concerns regarding self-KYC authentication. Reliance Jio, also planning a similar service, has put its launch on hold following the DoT's objections. The DoT mandates Aadhaar-based KYC completion before SIM card delivery, impacting both telecom operators' strategies for quick home delivery.
title: DoT sends 'national security reminder' to Airtel, Jio after SIM delivery plans

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: The Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) are celebrating extraordinary women through their Shahoshi Rani initiative during the IPL 2025 season. Forty women, recognized for their bravery and resilience, will attend KKR's practice session and interact with players and co-owner Juhi Chawla.
title: IPL 2025: KKR players to wear special kit at training before CSK game

author: TNN
description: Following India's strike on terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan and PoK, civilian flights were suspended at 20 airports in north and western India until May 10, 2025. Airlines, including IndiGo and Air India, cancelled flights to affected destinations, offering refunds and rescheduling options. Furthermore, many foreign airlines ceased overflying Pakistani airspace, leading to longer flight times and some cancellations.
title: Operation Sindoor: 20 airports closed till Saturday morning

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Indian speedster Mohammed Shami and several other cricketers have lauded the armed forces for "Operation Sindoor," a response to the Pahalgam terror attack. The Indian Air Force precisely struck nine terror launchpads across Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir without breaching Pakistani airspace. Gautam Gambhir, Harbhajan Singh, and others voiced strong support, emphasizing the operation's strategic precision and India's commitment to counter-terrorism.
title: 'Fateh moment': Mohammed Shami hails Indian army's 'Operation Sindoor'

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: IBM CEO Arvind Krishna urges the US government to increase federal funding for AI research and development, emphasizing its potential for economic growth and maintaining US competitiveness. He warns that proposed budget cuts to AI research programs could weaken America's global position. Despite past federal cutbacks impacting IBM, Krishna remains optimistic about increased R&D spending within a year.
title: IBM CEO makes request to Trump admin, says 'both IBM & I advocate ... '

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Meet the 4 Indians who will be voting to pick the next pope

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people, the Indian Army launched "Operation Sindoor," targeting nine terrorist locations in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir. The strikes, executed with precision, aimed at dismantling critical infrastructure belonging to terror groups like LeT, JeM, and Hizbul Mujahideen.
title: Operation Sindoor: Army releases videos of strikes on Pak terror camps

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, India executed Operation Sindoor, targeting nine terror camps across Pakistan and PoK linked to JeM, LeT, and HM. The strikes, a response to the killing of 26 civilians, aimed to dismantle key terror infrastructures. The operation targeted facilities like Markaz Subhan Allah and Markaz Taiba, crucial training and operational hubs.
title: 'Picture abhi baki hai': Former Indian Army chief drops cryptic post

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Suryakumar Yadav has distinguished himself in Mumbai Indians' history, achieving three IPL seasons with over 500 runs, surpassing Sachin Tendulkar and Quinton de Kock. This milestone was reached during a match against Gujarat Titans, where he scored 35 runs. Suryakumar now tops the IPL 2025 run charts with 510 runs in 12 matches, averaging 63.75 with a strike rate exceeding 170. He has scored three fifties this season, with a best of 67*.
title: Suryakumar Yadav breaks Sachin Tendulkar's iconic IPL record

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following Indian Army's 'Operation Sindoor' targeting terror camps in Pakistan and PoK, Pakistani media and social platforms spread false claims of retaliatory strikes. The Press Information Bureau (PIB) debunked these claims, including alleged attacks on Srinagar Airbase and downing of an Indian Rafale jet.
title: Did Pakistan shoot down Rafale jet during Operation Sindoor? PIB fact check says no

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Kartarpur corridor in Punjab's Gurdaspur was reportedly shut on Wednesday following India’s precision missile strikes on nine terror camps in Pakistan and PoK under Operation Sindoor. The strikes came two weeks after the Pahalgam terror attack. The corridor, opened in 2019 for visa-free pilgrimage, typically allows up to 5,000 Indian pilgrims daily to visit Kartarpur.
title: Kartarpur corridor shut after Operation Sindoor

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: 'Moment of pride': PM Modi hails precision strikes in 'Op Sindoor'

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Following India's Operation Sindoor targeting terror locations, Pakistan initially shut down its airspace for 48 hours, causing widespread flight disruptions and diversions. While restrictions were briefly lifted, Lahore's airspace faced another closure. Numerous international carriers rerouted flights.
title: Pakistan shuts airspace for 48 hours; several Asian airlines avoid route

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Watch: Army shares footage of strike on LeT suicide bomber training camp in PoK

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Adnan Sami, the singer, has voiced support for 'Operation Sindoor'. This operation targeted terrorist camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Several Bollywood figures, including Kangana Ranaut and Akshay Kumar, have also praised the Indian Armed Forces. The Ministry of Defence stated that the operation was a response to the Pahalgam terrorist attack.
title: Adnan Sami lauds ‘Operation Sindoor’ takes dig at Pakistani news anchors

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Jaish-e-Mohammad chief Azhar Masood reported the deaths of ten family members and four associates in 'Operation Sindoor,' conducted by the Indian Army. The strikes targeted a Jaish-e-Mohammed training center in Bahawalpur, Pakistan, following the Pahalgam terrorist attack that killed 25 Indians and one Nepali citizen. The Indian Army targeted nine terrorist bases across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied-Kashmir.
title: Op Sindoor: 10 family members, 4 aides of Masood Azhar killed in Indian strikes

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Operation Sindoor impact: Despite Indo-Pak military tensions, Indian markets have historically shown resilience, with the Nifty 50 experiencing modest declines followed by strong recoveries. Operation Sindoor had minimal impact, as markets focus on economic fundamentals and capital flows.
title: Operation Sindoor impact: Why Nifty, Sensex are unlikely to be hit too much

author: RASHMI DROLIA
description: A major anti-Maoist operation, 'Operation Sankalp,' launched on April 21 in the Bijapur district of Chhattisgarh, has resulted in the killing of more than 15 Maoists on Wednesday, bringing the total recovered bodies to 19. Security forces, including DRG, STF, CoBRA, and CRPF, have been targeting Maoist strongholds, destroying hideouts, and recovering explosives.
title: Over 15 Maoists gunned down in ‘biggest ever’ operation in Chhattisgarh's Bastar

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, India launched "Operation Sindoor" on May 7, targeting terror launchpads across Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir. Virender Sehwag and other prominent cricketers, including Gautam Gambhir and Harbhajan Singh, lauded the armed forces' precise execution. The operation, which strategically avoided breaching Pakistani airspace, targeted infrastructure of banned groups, conveying a strong message of accountable counter-terrorism.
title: Sehwag reacts on 'Operation Sindoor': 'Agar koi aap par patthar ... '

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Indian armed forces executed 'Operation Sindoor', dismantling nine terrorist camps in Pakistan and PoK in a swift 25-minute operation. Foreign Secretary Misri cited the Pahalgam attack as the impetus, emphasizing the need to deter further cross-border terrorism. Colonel Qureshi detailed the targeted sites, while Wing Commander Singh highlighted the strategic rationale and precision of the operation, ensuring minimal civilian impact.
title: 25 minutes, 9 terror camps, at least 70 terrorists: How Army executed Operation Sindoor

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India launched Operation Sindoor, targeting terror camps in Pakistan and PoK in retaliation for the Pahalgam attack. The operation destroyed multiple LeT and JeM training facilities, hitting nine sites with precision weaponry. Indian forces used SCALP cruise missiles, HAMMER precision-guided bombs, and loitering munitions, avoiding engagement with Pakistani military installations. The mission was described as focused, measured, and non-escalatory.
title: HAMMER & SCALP: Weapons India used to target terror sites in Pak, PoK

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: While Punjab Kings (PBKS) and Delhi Capitals (DC) are already there for their match on May 8, Mumbai Indians (MI) were scheduled to reach later this week. Now with Dharamsala airport, and neighbouring Amritsar and Chandigarh airports shut, the teams and the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) would look to swing a plan in action.
title: Operation Sindoor impact on IPL: With airports shut, Dharamsala travel plans hit

author: etimes.in
description: Dipika Kakar and Shoaib Ibrahim's ethnic apparel brand, Label DKI, faced rumors of shutting down, which Shoaib addressed in an Instagram Q&A. He clarified that the brand is not closing but experiencing delays in new stock. Shoaib also mentioned considering a discount sale on existing stock before launching fresh designs, dismissing the fake news circulating about the brand's closure.
title: Shoaib Ibrahim reacts to rumours of Dipika Kakar's Label DKI shutting down

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Following Operation Sindoor, several airlines have suspended air travel to northern India due to airport closures and airspace restrictions. IndiGo cancelled approximately 160 domestic flights, impacting services to high-alert zones. Air India, Alliance Air, SpiceJet, Air India Express, and Akasa Air also cancelled or rerouted flights, offering refunds and rescheduling options to affected passengers.
title: Airports shut, flights cancelled: How Op Sindoor has impacted air travel in north India

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Indian Armed Forces announced "Operation Sindoor," targeting Lashkar-e-Taiba and Jaish-e-Mohammed terror camps in Pakistan and PoJK. Colonel Sofiya Qureshi presented video evidence of successful strikes on terror camps, clarifying that no military installations were targeted and no civilian casualties were reported.
title: Govt releases footage of Army bombing terror camps in Pakistan & PoK

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Mumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya faced a Rs 24 lakh fine for a second slow over-rate offence, with his team also penalised. Gujarat Titans' head coach Ashish Nehra was fined 25% of his match fee and received a demerit point for conduct against the spirit of the game during their rain-affected match.
title: Hardik Pandya, Ashish Nehra heavily penalised after MI vs GT game

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Following the devastating Pahalgam attack, the Indian Armed Forces launched 'Operation Sindoor,' targeting nine terrorist camps across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. This precision mission aimed to dismantle key bases used for planning attacks against India. Bollywood celebrities, including Kangana Ranaut and Akshay Kumar, have lauded the armed forces' decisive action and expressed solidarity with the nation.
title: Kangana says ‘zero tolerance to terror’, wishes forces ‘safety & success’

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Sachin Tendulkar and other cricketers applaud Operation Sindoor. The operation retaliated against the Pahalgam terror attack. Indian Air Force targeted terror launchpads in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. The strikes focused on Jaish-e-Mohammed and Lashkar-e-Taiba infrastructure. Defence officials confirm targets were carefully selected. It reinforces India’s counter-terrorism policy. Operation Sindoor sparks national unity.

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following the Pahalgam terrorist attack that killed 25 Indians and one Nepali citizen, India launched 'Operation Sindoor,' targeting nine terrorist camps across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Foreign Secretary Misri cited intelligence of impending attacks, justifying the strikes as a necessary deterrent.
title: 'Targets chosen on credible intel': Govt shares details of 'Operation Sindoor'

description: Wing Commander Vyomika Singh jointly led the media briefing on 'Operation Sindoor,' India's retaliatory strike on terror camps in Pakistan and PoK, following the Pahalgam massacre. The operation targeted and destroyed nine terror hideouts, including camps linked to the 26/11 attacks.

The operation targeted and destroyed nine terror hideouts in Pakistan and PoK, focusing on Jaish-e-Mohammed, Lashkar-e-Taiba, and Hizbul Mujahideen. Col Qureshi, known for her leadership in multinational exercises and peacekeeping missions, exemplifies India's commitment to women in military roles.
title: Who's Col Sofiya Qureshi? Army officer who briefed world on 'Operation Sindoor'

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Following the launch of Operation Sindoor by the Indian government, Anand Mahindra, Chairman of Mahindra Group, voiced his support for the Indian Armed Forces. He conveyed a message of solidarity on Twitter, emphasizing national unity. Operation Sindoor targeted terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir in response to the Pahalgam terrorist attack.
title: Anand Mahindra on Operation Sindoor: Our prayers are with ...

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Bhuvneshwar Kumar credits Virat Kohli for transforming India's Test cricket with his aggressive mindset and focus on winning overseas. Kumar, who last played internationally in 2022, acknowledges emerging talents while quietly making an impact in IPL 2025 with 12 wickets in 10 games. Despite past injuries, he remains philosophical, focusing on present performance and expressing no regrets about his career.
title: Bhuvneshwar credits Virat Kohli for India's Test transformation

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Following India's military operations targeting terrorist facilities in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, the Pakistani stock market plummeted by 5%. In contrast, Indian markets displayed resilience, quickly recovering.
title: Pakistan stock market crashes 5% after India strikes terrorist camps

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Under 'Operation Sindoor,' the Indian Armed Forces executed precise military strikes on terrorist hideouts in Pakistan and PoK, targeting JeM and LeT leaders. The coordinated operation involved the Army, Navy, and Air Force, focusing on infrastructure used for planning attacks against India. The Ministry of Defence emphasized strategic restraint, avoiding Pakistani military facilities.
title: Explosions, smoke, panic: Viral videos capture India’s 'Operation Sindoor'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill joined Virat Kohli and Shreyas Iyer as the only IPL captains under 26 to score 500+ runs in a season. Gill's 43 against MI helped GT in a rain-affected chase of 156, where Rahul Tewatia and Gerald Coetzee secured a final-ball victory by three wickets. GT now leads the table, while MI's six-match winning streak ends.
title: Gill joins Kohli, Iyer in elite club after reaching major milestone

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, Indian armed forces executed missile strikes on terror camps in Pakistan and PoK under 'Operation Sindoor'. The Defence Ministry confirmed the strikes, emphasising they were focused and non-escalatory, specifically targeting terrorist infrastructure. Several prominent figures, including cricketers like Virender Sehwag, have reacted to the news on social media.
title: Operation Sindoor: Cricketers react after India strikes terror camps in Pakistan

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following the deadly Pahalgam attack, the Indian Army and IAF launched 'Operation Sindoor,' destroying nine terror hideouts linked to JeM, LeT, and Hizbul Mujahideen in Pakistan and PoK. The strikes targeted key training and operational centers, including Markaz Subhan Allah and Markaz Taiba, used for indoctrination, training, and planning attacks like the Pulwama bombing.
title: Operation Sindoor explained: Why these 9 terror hideouts were chosen by the Army

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Following India's precision strikes on terror bases in Pakistan and PoK, Kunal Ganbote, son of a Pahalgam attack victim, hailed the operation 'Sindoor' as justice. The tri-services operation targeted Jaish-e-Mohammed and Lashkar-e-Taiba, aiming to dismantle terror infrastructure linked to the deadly attack that killed 26, including six from Maharashtra.
title: 'Operation Sindoor is tribute to women like my mother': Son of Pune victim

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Indian armed forces executed Operation Sindoor, targeting terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir. This action avenged the Pahalgam terror attack. Strikes hit JeM and LeT headquarters, plus Hizbul Mujahideen sites. India used precision munitions and loitering drones. The operation aimed to dismantle terror infrastructure. It signifies a major escalation beyond previous cross-border actions.
title: Operation Sindoor vs Balakot: India raises the stakes with deep strikes in Pakistan

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Pakistani forces shelled villages along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir. Seven people died, including a woman and two children. Thirty-eight others sustained injuries. Poonch district experienced the most casualties. Indian Army retaliated to the ceasefire violations. The violations started after India conducted missile strikes on terror targets. Ten people were injured in Uri sector.
title: Seven dead, 38 injured as Pak Army targets civilian areas along LoC in J&K

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Following the tragic Pahalgam attack, the Indian Army launched 'Operation Sindoor,' targeting terror camps in Pakistan. Bollywood stars, including Riteish Deshmukh, Madhur Bhandarkar, and Paresh Rawal, swiftly expressed their support for the armed forces' decisive action. The strikes, confirmed by the Defence Ministry, targeted Jaish-e-Mohammed and Lashkar-e-Taiba, drawing widespread praise and reinforcing national unity.
title: Bollywood applauds Indian armed forces after Operation Sindoor

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Mumbai Indians faced a narrow defeat against Gujarat Titans, with captain Hardik Pandya lamenting the costly no-balls bowled by the team. Despite a spirited bowling performance led by Jasprit Bumrah and Trent Boult, MI fell short while defending a sub-par total of 155/8. Mumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya described the no-balls bowled by him and his teammates as a "crime" following their three-wicket defeat via the DLS method against Gujarat Titans in a thrilling contest at the Wankhede Stadium.
title: 'It is a crime': Hardik Pandya loses his cool

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Indian stock markets are expected to open lower on Wednesday following India's Operation Sindoor targeting terrorist facilities in Pakistan. GIFT Nifty indicates a negative start. Experts suggest market volatility could lead to a Nifty decline, influenced by geopolitical tensions and the US Federal Reserve's meeting. Investors are cautious amidst these developments, monitoring both domestic and international factors.
title: Operation Sindoor impact: How will Nifty50, BSE Sensex react?

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: With the league stage nearing its end, Chennai Super Kings, Rajasthan Royals, and Sunrisers Hyderabad are out of playoff contention. Royal Challengers Bengaluru, Gujarat Titans, and Punjab Kings are likely to advance, while Mumbai Indians and Delhi Capitals have a chance. Lucknow Super Giants and Kolkata Knight Riders face slim odds, with 16,384 possible result combinations remaining.
title: IPL playoffs scenarios: A look at the probabilities

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Under 'Operation Sindoor,' the Indian Armed Forces targeted nine terror facilities linked to Jaish-e-Mohammed, Lashkar-e-Taiba, and Hizbul Mujahideen in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. These strikes, conducted after the Pahalgam massacre, aimed to dismantle terrorist infrastructure used for planning attacks against India. The targeted locations included Markaz Subhan Allah in Bahawalpur and Syedna Bilal Camp in Muzaffarabad.
title: Operation Sindoor: Full list of 9 terror sites targeted by army in Pak, PoK

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: In response to the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 25 Indians and one Nepalese citizen, Indian Armed Forces initiated 'Operation Sindoor,' targeting nine terrorist infrastructure sites in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir. The strikes were described as focused and non-escalatory, avoiding Pakistani military facilities.
title: Operation Sindoor: India avenges Pahalgam terror attack, strikes 9 sites in Pak

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Singer Rahul Vaidya faced backlash after calling Virat Kohli a "joker" in a video mocking the cricketer's accidental like on actress Avneet Kaur's photo. Vaidya sarcastically blamed Instagram's algorithm, further escalating the situation. After revealing Kohli blocked him, Vaidya's comment about Kohli's fans being "bigger jokers" triggered angry reactions, including personal attacks.
title: 'Pagal nhi bola': Rahul Vaidya reveals why he called Virat Kohli 'joker'

author: TNN
description: India is set to conduct a large-scale civil defence exercise, "Operation Abhyaas," across multiple states, prompted by heightened Indo-Pak tensions following a terrorist attack. Border states like J&K, Punjab, Rajasthan, and Gujarat will lead the drills, featuring blackouts, sirens, and evacuation simulations. Other regions, including Bengal, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh, will also participate to enhance emergency preparedness and civilian safety.
title: Sound of sirens: Nationwide drill tests war readiness today

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers' Mehul Kothari recommends buying Jubilant Ingreva, Adani Total Gas, and Southern Petro. Jubilant Ingreva is poised for a breakout, while Adani Total Gas shows strong reversal signs. Southern Petro is in a steady uptrend, supported by its rising trendline.
title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: European leaders are actively courting American researchers with substantial financial incentives, viewing U.S. cuts to research funding as a critical mistake. France and the European Commission have pledged significant investments, totaling hundreds of millions of dollars, to attract talent and bolster their own research programs.
title: France President says US is committing error by withdrawing researchers’ visas

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: In a significant escalation, the Pakistan Army initiated unprovoked firing and artillery shelling along the Line of Control and International Border in Jammu and Kashmir, resulting in the tragic deaths of three civilians. This aggression follows India's launch of 'Operation Sindoor,' a counter-terror operation targeting terror infrastructure in Pakistan and PoK, in response to the Pahalgam terror attack.
title: '3 civilians killed in indiscriminate firing by Pak military across LoC, IB'

author: SACHIN PARASHAR
description: The UNSC's closed-door meeting on India-Pakistan tensions yielded no substantive outcome for Pakistan, with members advising bilateral resolution and accountability for the Pahalgam attack. Concerns were raised regarding Pakistan's nuclear rhetoric and missile tests, alongside questions about Lashkar-e-Taiba's potential involvement in the attack. Pakistan's efforts to internationalize the issue and promote a false-flag narrative faced disapproval.
title: At UNSC huddle, Pakistan faces tough questions

author: RAJAT PANDIT
description: Amidst heightened tensions, India is set to conduct a major air combat exercise near the Pakistan border in Rajasthan, deploying frontline fighters and force multipliers. This follows naval drills in the Arabian Sea, signaling India's readiness. Simultaneously, DGMOs from both countries are in communication regarding ceasefire violations along the LoC, where small arms fire continues.
title: IAF to launch major drill on Pakistan border from today

author: TNN
description: Amidst escalating tensions following the Pahalgam attack, Prime Minister Modi asserted India's control over its Indus waters, vowing to utilize them solely for the nation's benefit. Simultaneously, the IAF is preparing for a significant air combat exercise near the border, while military communication reveals ongoing concerns about unprovoked firing across the LoC, marking twelve consecutive nights of such incidents.
title: India’s water will flow, stop in India’s interests, be of use only to India: PM Modi

author: TNN
description: Prime Minister Modi asserted that India would utilize its rightful share of Indus River water, following the decision to pause the Indus Waters Treaty. He emphasized that the government prioritizes national interests, regardless of international reactions. Modi highlighted initiatives like river-linking projects to benefit farmers and reforms to empower marginalized communities, moving beyond vote-bank politics.
title: We act in India’s interest, not worried about world reaction: PM Modi

author: AMIT ANAND CHOUDHARY
description: The Supreme Court has released data revealing increasing diversity in high court judge appointments, with significant representation from women, OBCs, and minorities. While a small percentage have familial ties to judges, a majority come from diverse backgrounds, challenging perceptions of upper-caste dominance. A few recommendations are pending with the Centre, raising concerns about delays.
title: 17.5% women among 192 new HC judges

author: TNN
description: Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia announced that Apple intends to manufacture all its mobile phones in India, highlighting the country's emergence as a reliable and affordable manufacturing hub. He emphasized the significant growth in the telecom equipment market, driven by the government's PLI scheme, resulting in substantial investments, sales, exports, and job creation.
title: Apple to source, produce all its mobiles in India in years to come: Scindia

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
title: Inquiry panel confirms cash found at Justice Varma's house

author: SURENDRA SINGH
description: India's Gaganyaan mission, aiming to send humans into space, is now slated for the first quarter of 2027, announced by space minister Jitendra Singh. Following successful test missions, including TV-D1, the program involves multiple institutions and the armed forces. The budget has increased to Rs 20,193 crore to accommodate eight missions, including uncrewed flights with the robot Vyommitra.
title: Manned Gaganyaan mission in first quarter of 2027: Jitendra Singh

author: AMIT ANAND CHOUDHARY
description: The Supreme Court has made asset details of its judges public. Twenty-one out of thirty-three judges, including the Chief Justice, have declared their wealth. This information is available on the court's website. This move follows the 'cash-at-kothi' scandal. Judges will now declare assets upon assuming office and significant acquisitions to the CJI. These declarations will be mandatorily published online.
title: SC details assets of 21 judges, including CJI, and their kin

author: SANDEEP RAGHAVAN AND UMAMAHESWARA RAO
description: In Andhra Pradesh, two government school teachers sponsored air trips for seven high-achieving Class 10 students from underprivileged backgrounds, fulfilling a promise made to encourage academic excellence. The initiative motivated students to score high marks, with some experiencing their first-ever flight. This act of generosity highlighted the transformative impact of innovative teaching methods and the boundless opportunities that academic success can unlock.
title: Two government school teachers give high-flyers a ride in the clouds

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Air India diverted two international flights to Delhi due to air traffic disruptions following India's military action, 'Operation Sindoor', against terror camps in PoK. IndiGo and SpiceJet cautioned about potential delays and cancellations for flights to and from several northern cities.
title: Air India diverts two international flights amid 'Operation Sindoor' airspace curbs

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: In a retaliatory move for the Pahalgam terror attack, India launched "Operation Sindoor," executing precision strikes on nine terrorist bases across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.
title: Inside Operation Sindoor: How India carried out precision strikes on Pak

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Lauren Kyle, wife of Connor McDavid, shared glimpses of her luxurious life on social media, including her Porsche, diamond ring, and moments with friends. The posts came as McDavid and the Oilers focus on the playoffs against the Golden Knights. McDavid credited his teammates, particularly Pickard and Brown, for their recent win against the Kings.
title: Connor McDavid's wife Lauren Kyle flaunts her expensive lifestyle hours
